Class ActiveMerchant::Billing::CreditCard
In: lib/active_merchant/billing/credit_card.rb
Parent: Object

This credit card object can be used as a stand alone object. It acts just like a active record object but doesn’t support the .save method as its not backed by a database.

Methods

before_validate   card_companies   display_number   expired?   expiry_date   first_name?   last_name?   month   name   name?   type?   valid_number?   validate   verification_value?   year

Gateways will try their best to run validation on the passed in value if it is supplied

Public Class methods

card_companies()

Get the regexps for different card companies

Known card types

*Card Type* Prefix Length mastercard 51-55 16 visa 4 13, 16 american_express 34, 37 15 diners_club 300-305, 36, 38 14 enroute 2014, 2149 15 discover 6011 16 jcb 3 16 jcb 2131, 1800 15 bankcard 5610, 56022[1-5] 16 switch various 16,18,19 solo 63, 6767 16,18,19

[Source]

     # File lib/active_merchant/billing/credit_card.rb, line 143
143:       def self.card_companies
144:         { 
145:           'visa' =>  /^4\d{12}(\d{3})?$/,
146:           'master' =>  /^5[1-5]\d{14}$/,
147:           'discover' =>  /^6011\d{12}$/,
148:           'american_express' =>  /^3[47]\d{13}$/,
149:           'diners_club' =>  /^3(0[0-5]|[68]\d)\d{11}$/,
150:           'enroute' =>  /^2(014|149)\d{11}$/,
151:           'jcb' =>  /^(3\d{4}|2131|1800)\d{11}$/,
152:           'bankcard' =>  /^56(10\d\d|022[1-5])\d{10}$/,
153:           'switch' =>  [/^49(03(0[2-9]|3[5-9])|11(0[1-2]|7[4-9]|8[1-2])|36[0-9]{2})\d{10}(\d{2,3})?$/, /^564182\d{10}(\d{2,3})?$/, /^6(3(33[0-4][0-9])|759[0-9]{2})\d{10}(\d{2,3})?$/],
154:           'solo' =>  /^6(3(34[5-9][0-9])|767[0-9]{2})\d{10}(\d{2,3})?$/ 
155:         }
156:       end
type?(number)

Returns a string containing the type of card from the list of known information below.

[Source]

     # File lib/active_merchant/billing/credit_card.rb, line 159
159:       def self.type?(number)
160:         return 'visa' if Base.gateway_mode == :test and ['1','2','3','success','failure','error'].include?(number.to_s)
161:         
162:         card_companies.each do |company, patterns|
163:           return company if [patterns].flatten.any? { |pattern| number =~ pattern  } 
164:         end
165: 
166:         return nil
167:       end
valid_number?(number)

Returns true if it validates. Optionally, you can pass a card type as an argument and make sure it is of the correct type.

References

  • perl.about.com/compute/perl/library/nosearch/P073000.htm
  • www.beachnet.com/~hstiles/cardtype.html

[Source]

     # File lib/active_merchant/billing/credit_card.rb, line 173
173:       def self.valid_number?(number)
174:         return true if Base.gateway_mode == :test and ['1','2','3','success','failure','error'].include?(number.to_s)
175:         
176:         return false unless number.to_s.length >= 13
177: 
178:         sum = 0
179:         for i in 0..number.length
180:           weight = number[-1 * (i + 2), 1].to_i * (2 - (i % 2))
181:           sum += (weight < 10) ? weight : weight - 9
182:         end
183: 
184:         (number[-1,1].to_i == (10 - sum % 10) % 10)
185:       end

before_validate()

[Source]

    # File lib/active_merchant/billing/credit_card.rb, line 81
81:       def before_validate
82:         self.type.downcase! if type.respond_to?(:downcase)
83:         self.month = month.to_i
84:         self.year = year.to_i
85:         self.number.to_s.gsub!(/[^\d]/, "")
86:       end
display_number()

Show the card number, with all but last 4 numbers replace with "x". (xxxxxxxxxxxx-4338)

[Source]

     # File lib/active_merchant/billing/credit_card.rb, line 188
188:       def display_number
189:         return @number if @number.blank? || @number.length < 5
190:         "#{'x' * (@number.length - 4)}-#{@number[-4, 4]}"
191:       end

validate()

[Source]

     # File lib/active_merchant/billing/credit_card.rb, line 88
 88:       def validate
 89:         @errors.add "year", "expired"                             if expired?
 90:              
 91:         @errors.add "first_name", "cannot be empty"               if @first_name.blank?
 92:         @errors.add "last_name", "cannot be empty"                if @last_name.blank?
 93:         @errors.add "month", "cannot be empty"                    unless month.valid?
 94:         @errors.add "year", "cannot be empty"                     unless year.valid?
 95: 
 96:         # Bogus card is pretty much for testing purposes. Lets just skip these extra tests if its used
 97:         
 98:         return if type == 'bogus'
 99: 
100:         @errors.add "number", "is not a valid credit card number" unless CreditCard.valid_number?(number)                     
101:         @errors.add "type", "is invalid."                         unless CreditCard.card_companies.keys.include?(type)
102:         @errors.add "type", "is not the correct card type"        unless CreditCard.type?(number) == type
103:       end
